intro: Rorippa elstonii, commonly known as Elston's watercress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats such as stream banks and mountainous areas. It has small, alternate leaves that are usually submerged or floating, and it produces tiny white or yellow flowers. Its seeds are dispersed by water, allowing it to colonize new areas along aquatic environments.
